definitions.text: a geometric element that has position but no extension
examples: a point is defined by its coordinates

definitions.text: the precise location of something; a spatially limited location
examples: she walked to a point where she could survey the whole street

definitions.text: a brief version of the essential meaning of something
examples: get to the point
he missed the point of the joke
life has lost its point

definitions.text: an isolated fact that is considered separately from the whole
examples: several of the details are similar
a point of information

definitions.text: a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process
examples: a remarkable degree of frankness
at what stage are the social sciences?

definitions.text: an instant of time
examples: at that point I had to leave

definitions.text: the object of an activity
examples: what is the point of discussing it?

definitions.text: a V shape
examples: the cannibal's teeth were filed to sharp points

definitions.text: a very small circular shape
examples: a row of points
draw lines between the dots

definitions.text: the unit of counting in scoring a game or contest
examples: he scored 20 points in the first half
a touchdown counts 6 points

definitions.text: a promontory extending out into a large body of water
examples: they sailed south around the point

definitions.text: a distinct part that can be specified separately in a group of things that could be enumerated on a list
examples: he noticed an item in the New York Times
she had several items on her shopping list
the main point on the agenda was taken up first

definitions.text: a style in speech or writing that arrests attention and has a penetrating or convincing quality or effect

examples: his acting was one of the high points of the movie

definitions.text: sharp end
examples: he stuck the point of the knife into a tree

definitions.text: any of 32 horizontal directions indicated on the card of a compass
examples: he checked the point on his compass

definitions.text: a linear unit used to measure the size of type; approximately 1/72 inch

definitions.text: the dot at the left of a decimal fraction
the property of a shape that tapers to a sharp tip
a distinguishing or individuating characteristic
examples: he knows my bad points as well as my good points

definitions.text: the gun muzzle's direction
